metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1239 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in the j2k_read_ppm_v3 function in OpenJPEGbefore r2997, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome, allows remote attackersto cause a denial of service (process crash) via a crafted PDF.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1239` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
